Comment: A quick game in a GK tounament where my opponent made some poor choices and I made the most of them. I liked it because of the many attacking options/moves I could have played and guessing the defensive plays black could use once I was behind enemy lines. I have never studied any chess books so I am not up with chess lingo so I'll keep it simple. Hope you like...
Already a fairly rare opening. No idea what its called...
Already a fairly rare opening. No idea what its called...
Already a fairly rare opening. No idea what its called...
Don't want to exchange as I would be forced to then move my knight on the c file.
Don't want to exchange as I would be forced to then move my knight on the c file.
Better for development
The door is opened, not a good move
The door is opened, not a good move
The door is opened, not a good move
Getting ready....
Obviously not aware of my plan and a poor opening. The only piece developed by black has been exchanged.
Moving g-pawn to defend would be lose material as bishop would take and h-pawn, if it took the bishop, would give up the rook.
I thought I needed to get the front 2 black pawns out of the way so looking to move d2 to d4
I thought I needed to get the front 2 black pawns out of the way so looking to move d2 to d4
Seen by black so I go for plan B...
e6 would have been mate
e6 would have been mate
Always satisfying to get queen in there causing panic
Moving the bishop in the way I could then have taken g7 followed by the rook. If black had moved king to c6 it would be nicely in line with white bishop

I want the pawn out of the way so i can advance c-pawn and get black d-pawn away from its king. This opens up the possibility of moving the queen to check on the d file and also whites black bishop onto the a file in another threatening diagonal.
Black defends but now I see something else, and its not that I can capture material with my knight (white bishop would then have a clean run at the rook)
Black king now has nowhere to go, surronded by checked squares.
Preventing my knight from captuing material but not seeing the real problem although not sure there was much that could be done now

Game over, and with all but two pieces left on the board. I welcome all comments as I remember while playing there were lots of things going through my mind. I have not annotated them all as its a while since the game and I can't remember them all. Thanks to my opponent who's a good player but on this occasion just got it wrong.
